name: The Firey Depths
description: So you've built your first Nether Portal, but what it is exactly that is in there? What kind of new hell awaits you in the firey depths. Ghast, Zombie Pigmen and so much more. It's time to learn about the world beyond

quests.name: Crystal Clear
quests.description: You've entered the firey hellscape that is the nether, it's a wonderful place isn't it? Alright well that's a lie, but it does have a certain charm we suppose. It's time to learn what you can about this place and the resources you'll need from it.

tasks.longDescription: Quartz has some interesting properties which allow it to give off a certain electrical charge. So it's a good resource to farm. Having the Fortune enchant on a pick when mining it might net you more

Because so many things depend on the sun in the overworld, why not make use of a device that lets you know when it's actually out? Meet the Daylight sensor, which will send out a redstone pulse depending on the position of the sun. It is crafted with glass, quartz, and wood planks

tasks.description: You have a glow about you
tasks.longDescription: It's not just quartz there in the nether, hanging above you is this wonderful glowing stone that has more then a few potential uses. More then that it will help light up a room like no other.

quests.name: Sandy Souls
quests.description: So there is more then just netherrack and quartz. There's also this strange brownish looking substance that is.... staring at you. You might want to find out what that's all about right?

tasks.longDescription: Soul sand is unique in that it's the substance you'll eventually want to grow netherwart on (We'll talk about that shortly), You can turn it into glass, and you can even use it to just slow someone down. It should be all about the nether in large patches. You might also try putting this in a sieve.

Much like cobblestone, netherrack too can be cooked, but when it gets cooked it turns into this lovely netherbrick, which can be fantastic for decroation and also a hint more blast resistant then it's uncooked cousin.

quests.name: Butterfly in the sky
quests.description: That ghast can go twice as high. Take a look it wants to cook, all of you! It can go anywhere, places to explode and ways to run! But seriously this giant flying ghost wants to kill you

tasks.longDescription: The Ghast tear is a wonderful item with powerful properties that is dropped by those mean spirited flying evil creatures and it's definately worth a hint of investigation. From witchery to alchemy it has many different uses, but you have to kill a ghast first

You might have noticed that Ghast weren't the only horrible creatures which inhabit the nether. OUt there as well is the Blaze, and if you kill it, you might just get a Blaze rod. They're great as a source of fuel, but more then that they can help you get started on the path to alchemy

quests.name: X-Potion
quests.description: One of the worst things about a good Role Playing game is that you have to save all your potions. Well not this time, we're going to make sure you have 800 Skill points in Brewing by the time we've gotten done teaching you

tasks.longDescription: The start of any potion lies in the netherwart. Initially these can only be found in the seemingly unbreachable nether fortresses scattered across the nether. Placing it on soulsand will allow it to grow
You remember that blaze rod? Well combinging it with some cobble will get you the next component needed to get this whole process started, the brewing stand.

Now it's time to mix and match. Netherwart will always go first in these basic potions, then you can add other ingredients, like perhaps a ghast tear, or even sugar for going a bit faster. Expiriment with all the combintations and even the additives (like redstone and glowstone)

quests.name: The Worst kind of Skeleton
quests.description: There are few things more depressing then a crature made of such a mess. The Wither Skeleton which only spends it's time in the hearts of Nether Fortresses is one such crature. Kill one and take it's head and you will be on a path to very powerful things.

tasks.longDescription: The wither skeleton skull has a low chance of dropping, but place 3 upon a T shape of soul sand and you can summon into the world a powerful entity known as the wither. Killing it will reward and incredibly powerful prize.

quests.name: Farming the Fires
quests.description: So you have gotten used to farming in the real world, but what about farming elsewhere? Are you ready for such a thing? Well it's time to learn how to farm through the fire and the flames

tasks.longDescription: In the nether a simple Iron or stone ho simply won't do. No, now you're going to need to upgrade to the Diamond and Gold varients in order to till netherrack.

It turs out if you flip a few bits of a plants genetic code, it starts to learn to grow by lava and emit light! Who would have thunk it? These grow just like reeds in the overworld but they require lava! They can be ground up into glowstone rather then sugar

What kind of fun would we be having if we didn't have some wonderful ghostly seeds to really get our day started? Like wheat but requiring tilled netherrack and a lava source to help hydrate, these plants are quite the thing to see

quests.name: A Firey passion
quests.description: It's not just Glowing Reeds or Ghostly seeds that you should be on the lookout for. The nether also offers up a unique kind of cactus as well, and this one will just set your hearts ablaze!

tasks.longDescription: The blazing Cactoid like it's overworld cousin the cactus is a little painful to touch, but it can give you great rewards. Planting it on non tilled netherrack will let it grow for harvesting.
If you take this already burning little plant, you can throw it in the furnace and before you even know it the fuel will be there for you to find yourself with Blaze Nuggets.

Crafting those blaze nuggets in a 3x3 square (9 in total) will reward you with the Blaze ingot, which might give you a nice set of armor that lies between Iron and Diamond, It's definately worth some investigation!

quests.name: Berry Rewarding
quests.description: You didn't think in your overworld centric view that sunlight and water were the only places that had berries did you? Well now it's time to meet a whole new variety of berry bush.

tasks.longDescription: Much like the other nether crops, this must be grown on tilled netherrack next to lava in order to grow, but the little berries it drops can eventually be crafted in to quartz and who doens't like that?

Like its cousin the Quarz berry bush this again will require tilled netherrack and a lava source block to hydrate, but the berry's can be combined with an empty bucket to make a lava bucket which everyone can use.

quests.name: Bonemeal 2.0
quests.description: Alright so this stuff doesn't come in a fancy bottle and it's not exactly made from Algae extracts, but the Living soul is a great way to get your nether based plants to grow a little faster

tasks.longDescription: No seriously, you need bones, some rotten flesh, and some soul sand and you will be rewarded with this lovely smiling face (who can say no to that?) It can be applied to your nether crops to make them grow just a bit faster

quests.name: All you can drink
quests.description: Sometimes you just feel like you want to remove an ocean, but where could you possibly put all of that water? Well now there's an answer to that question.

tasks.longDescription: This bucket acts like any other except that when you put a liquid into it, you aren't getting it back. You can put as much of a liquid in there as you like but it's never filling up. Great for getting rid of small lakes and streams

quests.name: PK Fire!
quests.description: You know those days when you're playing super smash brothers and you get the home run bat? Well this is nothing like those days except that you have a bat with quite a swing.

tasks.longDescription: The bat doens't do that much damage but it can knock back your enemies a bit. Simply craft it with 2 netherbricks, a diamond, and 2 Knockback I books and you'll have your very own SSB tool of choice

quests.name: What's in the Box?
quests.description: So as you're exploring the nether you might just have noticed a few spare boxes sitting around doing nothing. Have you ever wondered by chance what those actually are? Well now it's time to learn!

tasks.longDescription: As if a Hopper and a chest had a child. This is a chest that you can throw things on top of and it will keep inside (So like a hungry chest). The recipie is simple enough, just put soulsand in a U Shape in the crafting bench with a single nether quartz at the top

This second variety of container you can get by cooking the first. You might even find these scattered throughout the nether with gifts inside already from the fallen adventurers of the past. The nice thing about this box is if you die it can store your things inside

quests.name: Power of the Star
quests.description: In most games a star is the key to being invisible, the literal power of the heavens, well after defeating a Wither you too will now have access to the stars

tasks.longDescription: Now that you have your netherstar it's time to mix it with a few ingredients. Surround the netherstar with eggs to get started on your concealment cap. Yes that's right normal chicken eggs

Alright now for the fun, if you can construct this wand you'll find it has the ability to turn whatever monster you choose to use it against into it's egg form. On it's own that doesn't seem incredibly useful, but there are certainly possibilities

quests.name: Glass the land
quests.description: So yo might have noticed that unlike the normal world which you are from, the properties of this one even allow you to cook soulglass into some glass, or even it's close cousin heat sand, which you might find scattered in the nether

quests.name: More Berry Fun
quests.description: If you thought you were done collecting berries it's time to think again. The nether is an endless expanse of all kinds of wonderful things to choose and eat. Some good, some bad

tasks.longDescription: These berries are found in colorful blue and purple bushes scattered throughout the nether. The bushes themselves can be planted on netherrack just about anywhere, but the real power is in their ability to heal and give a short jump boost

Found in red and black bushes throughout the nether that can be planted on netherrack, soul sand or even tained soil. These duskberries will restore some hunger, make you a bit blind and also give you night vision. Taste on to figure out how that all works out.

The purple and pink bush with little green berries that is the blightberry can be found in the nether and planted on netherrack or tainted soil. The blightberries they grow can give you 8 seconds of regeneration but 4 seconds of poison, so eat wisely
